page.title: 20Language in Fraserburgh
page.content: In Fraserbugh we speak a form of Doric.We use words like hoosie-house, lug-ear,fet-foot,Broch-Fraserburgh,fit like?-how are you? loon-boy and quine- girl.These are only a few examples. There are many forms of Doric. People in Peterhead use a different form than people here. We are proud to speak the Doric and it would be a shame if it died out. A man called Dr. David Murison, a former pupil of our school, has compiled a Scottish dictionary. CREDITS: Room 7, Fraserburgh Central School: Steve Alexander,Neil Bowie, Steve & Robert Buchan,Mark Dunbar,John Duthie,Robert Ironside,Gordon Reid, M. J. Summers, Mike Tocher, Edwin & Marie Wiseman,Susan Brown, Dianne & Pamela Buchan,Cath.Ellis,Elaine Hornal,Yvonne Innes,Audrey Kelly, Jenny Kerr,Julie McIntosh,Kelly Ritchie,Frances Sim, Dianne Taylor and Brenda Will. BYE BYE
